summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganKlairs Supple Preparation Facial Toner balances and maintains skin pH to optimize the efficacy and absorption of other products in your skincare routine.
details: DetailsBenefitsNon-irritating daily tonerDeeply moisturizing and nourishingBalances pH level of skinBoosts efficacy of other skincare productsKey IngredientsBeta Glucan: A sugar-derived ingredient that soothes irritation and rednessHyaluronic Acid: Boosts skin's moisture content by holding up to 1000 times its weight in waterCentella Asiatica Extract: A plant extract with powerful soothing properties that calms irritation and breakoutsLicorice root: A plant extract with antioxidant properties that improves the look of uneven skin toneFormulated WithoutEthanolSiliconeArtificial dyesArtificial fragrancesItem 2546686How To UseAfter cleansing, gently pat a small amount of toner onto dry skin with the palms of hands. Continue patting, using the heat of your palms to promote full absorption.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.IngredientsWater, Butylene Glycol, Dimethyl Sulfone, Betaine, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Natto Gum, Sodium Hyaluronate, Disodium EDTA, Centella Asiatica Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Polyquaternium-51, Chlorphenesin, Tocopheryl Acetate, Carbomer, Panthenol, Arginine, Luffa Cylindrica Fruit/Leaf/Stem Extract, Beta-Glucan, Althaea Rosea Flower Extract, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Portulaca Oleracea Extract, Lysine HCL, Proline, Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate, Acetyl Methionine, Theanine, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Eucalyptus Globulus Leaf Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens Flower Oil, Citrus Limon (Lemon) Peel Oil, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Cananga Odorata Flower Oil, Copper Tripeptide-1.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: After cleansing, gently pat a small amount of toner onto dry skin with the palms of hands. Continue patting, using the heat of your palms to promote full absorption.Precautions: For external use only. Do not get into eyes.

reviews.headline: Favorite toner ever
reviews.comments: Keeps my skin feeling soft and hydrated better than any other toner I've tried. Highly recommend

reviews.headline: Broke out
reviews.comments: Dont recommend, i hardly ever breakout and it left little bumps, itchy, and nope;(

reviews.headline: HG Toner
reviews.comments: I have rosacea and this is far & away the best product I've used. I've been using this for years, scented version doesn't effect my skin at all. I'm almost 50 and get told I don't look it, this product has been the constant in my routine for a few years now. I absolutely love it and buy in bulk when on sale.

reviews.headline: Fav. Toner Ever!
reviews.comments: Love this toner! Although scented, it is not a rough scent. Smells a lot like the products my esthi uses and it leave my combo skin feeling fantastic. Sometimes use it with a pad and other times i just pat it into my face.

reviews.headline: Please never stop making this!
reviews.comments: I recently changed my skin care routine, and this step seems to be one of the reasons my skin has improved. It's more evenly toned (you put it on FIRST before any creams etc) and hydrated than it's been in years. Even my husband noticed ( and how often does that happen?!). I 100 percent recommend.

reviews.headline: wouldn't use or buy again.
reviews.comments: i really wanted to like this toner but unfortunately for me, it caused me to breakout. the toner did everything it said it would doâ€¦ moisturize, balance ph, etc. so for that reason, if you don't have acne prone skin, it's def worth a try.

reviews.headline: Love It!
reviews.comments: I have already purchased two bottles of this toner and am currently purchasing my third. I absolutely love it! It leaves my dry skin hydrated and helps all of my other products absorb better. It has no harsh ingredients as far as I can tell so I use it every night. I would absolutely recommend it, especially to anyone else who needs a little extra hydration!

reviews.headline: Love the consistency and effect
reviews.comments: Really happy with this toner! I was previously using The Good Acids from Peach and Lily but felt like I was going through it too quickly. This has a thicker texture, not thick but not just liquid like most toners. It feels more substantial than a liquid toner and like the product goes further. I feel like this is so moisturizing too! I'll put it on and sometimes almost forget that I haven't finished my routine bc it just feels really nice. I'll be making this a permanent part of my routine.

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: A YouTuber I watch always raves about Klairs so I decided to give them a try, but this product made my face burn so bad. Caused redness and breakouts. I'm shocked there's so many great reviews.

reviews.headline: Amazing!!!
reviews.comments: This toner is amazing. It gets rid of the redness in my skin and it instantly moisturizes my face. Make sure to read the instructions before using, this is not a toner from years ago. I will rebuy over and over as long as the company doesn't change the formula

reviews.headline: Dare I Say This is a Holy Grail??
reviews.comments: I rarely rebuy products and almost never stick to a single brand or product long-term. I love trying new products and always have exacting standards so I'm always seeking the next best thing. I use the Korean 7-Step Method morning and night and have been seeking a really hydrating toner. I bought this one to reach an order minimum but wasn't super hopeful because I feel meh about some of Klairs other products. However, I instantly fell in love with this toner! It's a good light-medium consistency so rather than being watery or creamy, it's somewhere in between. It instantly hydrates my skin and sinks in without sitting on my skin surface. Especially as the winter months have been especially dry this year, this toner has helped tremendously in hydrating my skin to prevent dryness and peeling. As added bonuses, this toner is affordable and cruelty-free, which are both requirements for me to purchase a product. I have combination to dry skin and do get the occasional breakout from a new product but haven't had any breakout issues with this product. It is gentle and does not burn, sting, or have a strong smell. I don't think this toner is comparable to any other toner that I have tried and I plan to permanently incorporate it into my routine, though I'm unsure if I will do so as a day or night or seasonal-only toner. Highly recommend!

reviews.headline: A New Staple
reviews.comments: Loved this toner! I use it every morning and it does a great job prepping my skin for makeup. I love to slap on a million different products every morning, but I can comfortably just use this and moisturizer in the morning if I'm in a hurry and my skin looks great either way!

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: First toner I've used at 40+ years old and I love it. Nice light layer after cleansing before moisturizing, feels great on skin especially in colder weather when your skin can dry quickly. Highly recommend, leaves skin soft and primed, esp for my dry /combo skin.

reviews.headline: Disgusting Smell
reviews.comments: Hate the smell

reviews.headline: EXCELLENT!
reviews.comments:
I love this toner! It's the best gentle, calming toner that gives me glowy, hydrated, plump skin. The texture is like a cross between that of a hyaluronic acid serum and a regular hydrating toner. I use another toner with either glycolic acid or witch hazel to remove excess dirt and makeup around the perimeter of my face after I second cleanse, then I pat this on using just my hands. About 3 drops is all I need for my whole face. A little goes a long way. 

It's just a simple, very nice toner to apply. It almost feels cooling as it goes on. The scent is lovely; gentle, soothing and spa-like. I may have never discovered it had it not been for Ulta's 21 Days of Beauty. Very happy to have come upon it. It is now a staple product in my routine. Great price for the quality of the product, imo. I love the dark bottle and the label as well. The whole user experience is just A+.

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments: Absolutely love this toner. Leaves your skin soft and supple. Nice texture when applying- a bit thicker than traditional toner. Have been using it for about 3 weeks now and has definitely become a new staple.

reviews.headline: Buy this now!
reviews.comments: I am so happy I took a chance on this toner it leaves my skin so soft and clean. And a really good deal for the amount you get. I have previously purchased Pauls Choice toner that is similar but cost $34 for 4oz! but this might even work better honestly.

reviews.headline: worth but dont buy from ulta
reviews.comments: 5/5 for the product but -2 stars due to the packaging. this is a great product that is hydrating. i have sensitive and acne prone skin and this did not break me out or cause an irritation. i've been using this daily for years and highly recommend this product. i DO NOT recommend buying from Ulta though. when i received it, the outer box was open, and smushed. the bottle inside was quite dusty as well. luckily the seal for the actual product was not broken.

reviews.headline: I only write reviews for products I love!
reviews.comments: My skin gets easily irritated if I fall off my routine. I used this item for ONE day (morning and night use) and my redness/ irritation was gone! I ordered this during the sale and have had issues with other brands of toners in the past giving me irritation/breaking me out. I decided to order it on sale to give it a chance, but even the full price is worth it!!

reviews.headline: Worth buying
reviews.comments: Was in the market for new toner and came across this with its high review. I have sensitive skin and always broke out when trying new products. This hasn't broken me out yet (knock on wood). I use this as a part of my night routine, it's hydrating and doesn't have a strong scent to it (it does have a slight medicine smell but it goes away). It's definitely worth the 5 star ratings

media.headline: Great for sensitive and dry skin!!

faceoff_positive.comments: I'm almost ashamed to admit that I've been stockpiling this. Also, I have it in various sizes - 180ml bottles, 30ml bottles, 3ml bottles. Basically I am able to bring with me wherever I go so that I never have to be without it. I even use it on my body because I've got really dry skin sometimes. I'm so uncomfortable with not using this that I feel as though I'm going to get a breakout if I use a different toner? Must be some warped psychological effect. I've used various toners before and none of them made me feel like something is happening. Most toner simply feel like overpriced water to me. Some are overly perfumed chemical smelling water, which I absolutely hate. Then I had the chance to try out this from one of the samples I received. This smells so organic and fragrance free. The texture is slightly more tacky than water but still viscous enough to be absorbed easily. I fell in love. As this toner feels so good, I don't even care about the cleansers I use anymore because I figured that any drugstore cleanser works since I'm going to be slapping this on immediately and it would adjust the pH level of my skin to a healthy range. This toner is mild, non-irritating, does not break me out. It is so mild that when it gets into my eye area, it doesn't not sting my tear ducts. In fact, I think a little entered my eyes just now when I used it, but I didn't feel anything. Either this has a numbing agent or it is simply very mild. So given how mild it is, this doesn't do anything to cure acne, FYI so don't be counting on that. This also doesn't minimise your pores. What this does really well is make your skin feel relieved and well moisturised after a thorough cleansing. I kind of noticed that the fine lines on my forehead seem to have reduced ever since I started using this toner. My forehead tends to be extremely dry and wrinkly. Now, it is more plumped and makeup no longer goes on patchy. I'm able to pull a better heist in conning people into thinking that I have stunning complexion. Regarding my method of application, I like to pour it into my palm and pat it in for half a minute. I don't see the value in using a cotton pad because I'm pretty good at cleansing my face and generally will not have leftover dirt or soap on my face after cleaning. So I feel that a cotton pad may be a waste of perfectly good toner. It's absorbing toner away from my skin. If there's one item you want to try from Klairs, it has to be this. I never cared for toners until I started using this.
faceoff_positive.headline: So good that I stockpile this

faceoff_negative.comments: I like it and I will continue to use it but I can't say that I would repurchase unless for some reason I were unable to get a better toner elsewhere. I don't have any issue with the scent or the essential oils and I have pretty sensitive skin and I am usually not a fan of essential oils but this doesn't irritate me at all. It isn't as hydrating as I would like but would be fine for normal skin or someone who isn't looking for hydration in their toner. I just use this after my acid toner then layer a moisturizing serum over it or maybe a hyaluronic acid over. I don't find it to be sticky, it sinks in to my skin nicely. I wish Ulta would not discontinue so many of the dear klairs products (rich moist soothing cream and the midnight blue calming cream are both amazing). It is so much more convenient to order from Ulta than from Hong Kong but if Ulta won't carry Korean skincare I have no other choice.
faceoff_negative.headline: it's okay
